byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and ADAM LIPTAK

abstract: Conservative religious schools all over country are confronting possibility that Supreme Court approval of constitutional right to same-sex marriage could result in their losing their tax-exempt status unless they move to accept same-sex relationships.
lead_paragraph: If the Supreme Court finds a constitutional right to gay marriage, religious schools say they could lose tax-exempt status for opposing same-sex relationships.

headline.main: Schools Fear Gay Marriage Ruling Could End Tax Exemptions
headline.print_headline: Schools Fear Marriage Ruling Could End Tax Exemptions

snippet: If the Supreme Court finds a constitutional right to gay marriage, religious schools say they could lose tax-exempt status for opposing same-sex relationships.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
